intro: Populus caudina, commonly known as the Caudina poplar, is a species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a broad, rounded crown. The leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with a serrated margin and a dark green upper surface. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in catkins during the spring, followed by winged seeds that are dispersed by the wind. This plant is adapted to well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks.
